hero.subText: A fresh graduate Software Engineer from University of Minho

description: A new graduate in Integrated Master’s in Informatics Engineering at the University of Minho specialized in distributed systems and high-performance computing. Passionate about a wide range of areas varying from designing beautiful UIs to finding creative and efficient solutions.

I consider myself a creative person therefore, creating things and seeing them grow as time goes by is one of my passions. Currently, I have developed multiple front-end projects however I aim to be a full-stack dev to impact and help in every part of the product I am working on.

Though technical experiences and capabilities are essential, I believe that social experiences and dealing with social problems that are not present in my daily life provide unique opportunities to learn. Ultimately, this expands my way of thinking and develops my capability to understand the people around me.

skills.description: Technologies and languages that I got in touch with to develop the multiple projects I was in over the years.

TargetTimeline.subtitle: Working Process
TargetTimeline.title: Technical Journey
TargetTimeline.description: These are some of my journey's milestones since I joined college until now. These milestones refer to areas related with my deegre and software engineering in general.

events.name: XPadel Technologies
events.text: Currently developing a product to empower the user experience of padel players and courts.

events.name: Result's Platform of EMACI 22
events.text: Developed the front-end for the European Master Athletics Championships Indoor. An event that counted with 2000+ attendes from 40+ countries.

events.name: Research Assistant at INESCTEC
events.text: Developing an implementation of the consensus protocol Disk Paxos using a high-performance toolkit for hard drive access.

events.name: Meeting Braga Website
events.text: Designed and developed a website to support the annual event, Meeting Braga. The solution enables the organization to manage and create new editions of the events.

events.name: Project Manager at PEI Course
events.text: Project Manager of Nite, a digital drinking card for pubs and nightclubs. Nite provides a system that empowers the experience of a customer when at one of these establishments by allowing digital payments and remote control of each card. The team had nine people from different backgrounds and forced me to build team spirit, solve internal issues, and coordinate multiple tasks.

events.name: Summer Internship at AnyBrain
events.text: Any Brain develops machine learning software to detect video game fraud. Worked in 2 distinct tasks. The first one required an analysis of multiple machine learning algorithms implementation such as LighGBM, H2O, and Sci-Kit in a company dataset. The second was the development of a local cache using Redis to reduce the charge placed in both the system and the network.

TargetTimelineSocial.subtitle: Working Process
TargetTimelineSocial.title: Side Journey
TargetTimelineSocial.description: These are some of the projects I have been involved in. They showed me a whole new world and played a huge role in the person I am today.

events.name: Coordinated a team for 15 days in Chamusca's Camp
events.text: Managed and coordinated a team of 5 during the house intervention in Chamusca. Was responsible for the success of the program and had to face many challenges to ensure that everything was completed on time.

events.name: Integrated the direction team of Óbidos's Camp
events.text: With the "Livre" role, supported the house rehabilitation teams with anything needed.

events.name: Coordinated teams in Just a Change's Initiatives
events.text: Coordinated and managed multiple teams in both "Keep Up" and "All In" initiatives during 2021/2022.

events.name: Camp In, Just a Change
events.text: Rehabilitated two houses during the summer for people who live in inhuman conditions and don't have the resources nor the energy to change their lives. By improving their living conditions, we hope that they find the will needed to change their situation.

events.name: Volunteer at Bagos d'Ouro
events.text: Helped a twelve year's old kid improving his score at math by developing study methods, overcoming self-confidence, and helping him discover a way to solve problems.

events.name: Camp In, Just a Change
events.text: Just a Change is a nonprofit organization that rehabilitates houses in rural and poor areas of Portugal. As part of their "Camp In" initiative, I spent 13 intensive days rehabilitating a house of an elderly man that lived in inhuman conditions.

events.name: Joined UDREAM's Program
events.text: U.DREAM is an educational project which has the mission of educating students to be social leaders. This project focus on solving three main issues related to the difficulty of finding individual purpose, managing relations, and generate social impact in your community. The members work not only with self-development but are also involved in social experiences like accompaniments to families whose kids have serious health issues or nursing homes.

projects_description.name: Nite
projects_description.short_description: A digital drinking card solution for pubs and nightclubs.
projects_description.description:
Nite is a digital drinking card for pubs and nightclubs. Nite provides a system that empowers the customer's experience inside these establishments, allowing digital payments and remote control of the customer's card.

The development team had nine developers working in two mobile apps, a web app, and a back-end system. I was responsible for a mobile app and for managing the team's progress.

As a manager, I ensured that the team's goals were met and that everyone was motivated and in sync with our objective.
projects_description.subtitle: Product

projects_description.name: EMACII
projects_description.short_description: Result's platform for European Master Athletics Championships Indoor
projects_description.description:
European Master Athletics Championships Indoor is an annual international athletics event where the best veteran athletes from all around the world compete.

As the front-end developer, developed the result's website where all information about the competitions was presented. The event counted with more than 2000 attendes and 460 competions.
projects_description.subtitle: Web Develpment

projects_description.name: Bomberman
projects_description.description:
As part of the Informatics Laboratories Course, my first project in university was to develop a remake of the classic game Bomberman. The solution was fully developed using only functional programming.

Since it was my first project, the codebase isn't that great and could be improved. Nevertheless, the result was one of the best projects of the entire course and was added to the course's hall of fame.
projects_description.short_description: A remake of the classic Bomberman game.
projects_description.subtitle: Game

projects_description.name: totasky
projects_description.description:
A Desktop application built using Vue.Js and Electron to keep track of weekly tasks. This project's main purpose was to get to know new technologies and frameworks.

The application could be synchronized with a Google account. This feature allowed an automatic addition of new tasks based on Google Calendar's schedule.
projects_description.short_description: A Desktop App to keep track of weekly tasks.
projects_description.subtitle: Desktop App

projects_description.name: Meeting Braga
projects_description.description:
Meeting Braga is an annual athletics event that groups together both national and international participants. Since the event grows larger every year, the organization requested a website to display details about each event edition.

The website was developed using NextJs and MongoDB and has a management dashboard that updates the information related to every edition.
projects_description.short_description: A website built for the annual event, Meeting Braga.
projects_description.subtitle: Web Develpment
